member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.ChipInfo.Register(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Registers this ChipInfo to the ChipRegistry.
member.param: The registry name to use.
If specified, will use this registry ID.
If false, will not register if the preferred ID is already used. Ignored if no preferred ID is specified.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.ChipInfo.PostRegister
member.summary: Called after this Registry Entry has been registered to its Registry. You should never call this yourself.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.ChipInfo.GetEntryType
member.summary: Returns the Registry Entry's Type enum. Used in the registration process, although it is safe to check this yourself by directly accessing the property.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.ChipInfo.GetRegistry
member.summary: Returns the singleton of the registry used for storing this type of Registry Entry.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.ChipInfo.IsValidIDForType(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns whether the specified ID is valid for this Registry Entry's Type.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.ChipInfo.GetNextIDForType(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the next valid ID for this Registry Entry's Type, after the provided lastValidID. Should skip the vanilla ID range.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.ChipInfo.IsChipActive(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if the chip should be considered to currently be in use, and should not be allowed to be activated again. Override to add custom behavior - by default, always returns false.

member.name: E:GadgetCore.API.ChipInfo.OnUse
member.summary: Invoked whenever this chip is activated. Will never be invoked if the ChipType is not ACTIVE. The int parameter is the slot the chip is in.

member.name: E:GadgetCore.API.ChipInfo.OnEquip
member.summary: Invoked whenever this chip is equipped. The int parameter is the slot the chip is being equipped to. This is invoked immediately after the chip is placed into the slot.

member.name: E:GadgetCore.API.ChipInfo.OnDequip
member.summary: Invoked whenever this chip is dequipped. The int parameter is the slot the chip is being dequipped from. This is invoked immediately before the chip is removed from the slot.

member.name: T:GadgetCore.API.ChipInfo.ChipCostType
member.summary: This indicates what should the active chip's cost represent.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ChipInfo.ChipCostType.MANA
member.summary: The cost represents a number of points of mana, as normal chips do.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ChipInfo.ChipCostType.ENERGY
member.summary: The cost represents a number of points of stamina.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ChipInfo.ChipCostType.HEALTH_SAFE
member.summary: The cost represents a number of points of health, although activating the chip will be unable to kill the player, and if it would the activation fails.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ChipInfo.ChipCostType.HEALTH_LETHAL
member.summary: The cost represents a number of points of health, and activating the chip is able to kill the player if they have less than or equal to the number of points of health that the cost requires. If the player dies from attempting to activate this chip, then the effect does not get activated.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ChipInfo.ChipCostType.HEALTH_LETHAL_POSTMORTEM
member.summary: The cost represents a number of points of health, and activating the chip is able to kill the player if they have less than or equal to the number of points of health that the cost requires. If the player dies from attempting to activate this chip, then the effect still activates. Note that at the moment of invocation, the player well have 0 or less health, and will be flagged as dead (GameScript.dead == true) but the death screen will not have opened yet, and the death will be canceled if the chip restores the player's health.

member.name: T:GadgetCore.API.ChipType
member.summary: Specifies what type of chip this is. If you wish for your chip to grant both passive and active effects, use ACTIVE.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ChipType.PASSIVE
member.summary: This chip is passive, and cannot be activated.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ChipType.ACTIVE
member.summary: This chip is active, and can be activated. Note that active chips can still grant passive effects, if you desire.

member.summary: Called for every configurable mod and Gadget when the Mod Menu is injected into the title screen. This is called again if the player returns to the title screen after having selected a character. You should never call this yourself.
member.param: A on the Mod Menu canvas intended to be used as the parent object of your config menu. This object will also be enabled and disabled as needed to open and close the config menu.

member.param: Used to check if an item is valid for a slot.
Used to check if the items currently in the slots are valid for a recipe. The Item array is of length 4, where the first three Items are the inputs, and the fourth Item is the output.

The Item array is of length 4, where the first three Items are the inputs, and the fourth Item is the output. The index of the CraftPerformer to replace

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String[],System.String[],System.Int32,System.String[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean,GadgetCore.API.VersionSpecificity,GadgetCore.API.VersionSpecificity,System.String)
member.summary: Required by classes that extend Gadget. Provides information about your Gadget.
member.param: The friendly name of this Gadget. Also used for registry names. Should not contain special characters.
Whether multiplayer clients attempting to connect without this Gadget should be rejected.
Whether the Gadget should default to being enabled or not when first installed.
The list of any and all Gadgets that this Gadget should load after, regardless of
The list of any and all Gadgets that this Gadget should load before, regardless of
The priority for loading your Gadget. Higher number means higher priority. Leave at 0 if you don't care.

The names of any and all other Gadgets that your Gadget is dependent upon. If they are not present, your Gadget will not be loaded, and if your Gadget has the same load priority as them, your Gadget will be guaranteed to load after them. May include version numbers with the syntax of \"ModName v1.0\". The level of precision used in the specified version number indicates the version specificity of the dependency.
Whether this Gadget can be reloaded at runtime. Gadget reloads will also cause the config to be reloaded. Defaults to true.
Whether this Gadget can have its config reloaded at runtime, without reloading the entire Gadget. Defaults to true.
The point at which a difference between the mod versions of the host and client should flag an incompatibility.
The point at which a change to GadgetCore should flag this Gadget as incompatible.
The version of GadgetCore your Gadget is made for. This is automatically assigned to the version of GadgetCore you are building with, so you should always leave this at default.

member.summary: Creates an empty Item, used to represent the content of an empty slot.

member.summary: Creates a copy of an Item.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.ConstructItemFromIntArray(System.Int32[])
member.summary: The base game transmits Items across the network using int arrays. This method converts an int array into an Item, and restores the Item's extra data in the process. Indexes 0-10 of the array are used for vanilla data, while indexes 11 and up are used for any and all extra data, and are encoded in a format that is not meant to be manually read.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.ConstructIntArrayFromItem(Item)
member.summary: The base game transmits Items across the network using int arrays. This method converts an Item into an int array, and preserves the Item's extra data in the process. Indexes 0-10 of the array are used for vanilla data, while indexes 11 and up are used for any and all extra data, and are encoded in a format that is not meant to be manually read.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.EmptyEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an IEnumerator that does nothing. Use when you need to return an IEnumerator, but you don't want it to do anything and you can't use null.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.SpawnItem(UnityEngine.Vector3,Item,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Use to spawn an item into the game world. You may notice that the vanilla game's source-code uses Resources.Load to spawn items. You should not use that.
member.param: The position to spawn the item at. Note that despite being a 2D game, Roguelands uses 3D space. That being said, the z-coordinate should nearly always be 0.
The item to spawn.
True to drop a chip instead of a normal item.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.SpawnItemLocal(UnityEngine.Vector3,Item,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Use to spawn an item into the local player's world. You may notice that the vanilla game's source-code uses Resources.Load to spawn items. You should not use that.
member.param: The position to spawn the item at. Note that despite being a 2D game, Roguelands uses 3D space. That being said, the z-coordinate should nearly always be 0.
The item to spawn.
True to drop a chip instead of a normal item.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.SpawnExp(UnityEngine.Vector3,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use to spawn exp into the world. You may notice that the vanilla game's source-code uses Resources.Load to spawn exp. You should not use that.
member.param: The position to spawn the item at. Note that despite being a 2D game, Roguelands uses 3D space. That being said, the z-coordinate should nearly always be 0.
The amount of exp points to spawn.

The item to spawn.
True to drop a chip instead of a normal item.

member.summary: Gets the item material with the specified ID.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.GetTileMaterial(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the tile material with the specified ID.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.GetChipMaterial(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the chip material with the specified ID.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.GetWeaponMaterial(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the weapon material with the specified ID. Used for when the weapon is equipped.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.GetOffhandMaterial(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the offhand material with the specified ID. Used for when the offhand item is equipped.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.GetHeadMaterial(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the head material with the specified ID. Used for when a helmet is equipped.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.GetBodyMaterial(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the body material with the specified ID. Used for when an armor is equipped, or for the worn outfit if no armor is equipped.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.GetArmMaterial(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the arm material with the specified ID. Used for when an armor is equipped, or for the worn outfit if no armor is equipped.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.GetDroidHeadMaterial(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the droid head material with the specified ID. Used for the head of a droid, which is animated seperately from the body.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.GetDroidBodyMaterial(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the droid body material with the specified ID. Used for the body of a droid, which is animated seperately from the head.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.GetRaceMaterial(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the race head material with the specified ID and variant. Used for when no helmet is worn.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.GetSignMaterial(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the world sign material with the specified world ID. This is the colored bar that is shown inside of portals.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.GetTerrainSideMaterial(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the terrain side material with the specified world ID. This is used to fill in each side of a chunk that doesn't lead anywhere.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.GetTerrainZoneMaterial(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the terrain zone material with the specified world ID. This represents the four L-shaped corners of a terrain chunk. Does not include the sides, or the mid-chunk.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.GetTerrainEntranceMaterial(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the terrain entrance material with the specified world ID. This is the entrance room of a world. It is flipped and re-used for the exit as well.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.GetTerrainMidChunkMaterial(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the terrain mid-chunk material with the specified world ID. This is the chunk of terrain in the middle of a room. Has a variant with an opening in the middle, and one without.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.GetWorldBackgroundMaterial(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the world background material with the specified world ID and depth index. There are four of these for each world, and they are used to draw the world's background. The depth index goes from 0 to 3 - a higher index indicates farther back into the background, and generally means a darker-colored material.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.GetWorldParallaxMaterial(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the world parallax material with the specified world ID. This is a vertical color gradient used to create the background parallax effect.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.GetFactionFlagMaterial(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the faction flag material with the specified ID. This refers to the allegiance icon shown in the character creation screen. In vanilla, it is either The Galactic Fleet, the Starlight Rebellion, the Church of Faust, or the Gray Enigma. There are two additional unused flags with the IDs of 4 and 5: 4 is for the Junkbelt Mercenaries, and 5 is for the Droidtech Enterprise.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.GetDifficultyFlagMaterial(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the difficulty flag material with the specified ID. This refers to the difficulty icon shown in the character creation screen. In vanilla, it is either Standard or Ironman. For some reason, IDs 2 through 5 are also used by the vanilla game, and are copies of the 'Standard' flag. (ID 0)

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.GetChatPortraitMaterial(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the chat portrait material with the specified ID. This is the character portrait shown when in dialog with an NPC, and the ID is not necessarily related to the NPC being spoken to in any way, although NPCs added with Gadget Core will have the same portrait ID.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.GetMiscellaneousMaterial(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the miscellaneous material with the specified name. This is used for any material that does not fit into another catagory. In vanilla, this includes menus and UI elements, opened chests, and the planet icons as shown in the planet selector, among other things.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.GetPropResource(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the prop with the specified ID. A Prop is the in-world object representing any ship tile that has custom behavior. In the vanilla game, this is the engine blocks, the lamp blocks, and the spawner block, as well as all of the cards and badges. Keep in mind that interactable objects have their props saved as NPCs, for whatever reason.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.GadgetCoreAPI.GetEntityResource(System.String)

member.name: E:GadgetCore.API.ItemInfo.OnUse
member.summary: This event is invoked whenever the player uses the item while it is in the hotbar. Not to be confused with when a weapon is equipped and the player attacks with it. The inventory slot of the item is passed as the parameter. Return false to prevent the item from being used.

member.name: E:GadgetCore.API.ItemInfo.OnUseFinal
member.summary: This event is invoked whenever the player uses the item while it is in the hotbar. Not to be confused with when a weapon is equipped and the player attacks with it. The inventory slot of the item is passed as the parameter. It must return an IEnumerator, so you can add Coroutines for this event. It is valid to return null if it is not a coroutine.

member.name: E:GadgetCore.API.ItemInfo.OnEquip
member.summary: This event is invoked whenever the player equips this item. (Weapon, Offhand, Helmet, Armor, Ring, or Droid). The inventory slot of this item is passed as the parameter.

member.name: E:GadgetCore.API.ItemInfo.OnDequip
member.summary: This event is invoked whenever the player dequips this item. (Weapon, Offhand, Helmet, Armor, Ring, or Droid). The inventory slot of this item is passed as the parameter.

member.name: E:GadgetCore.API.ItemInfo.OnAttack
member.summary: This event is invoked whenever the player attacks with this item. It must be a , and it must be equipped to the weapon slot. It must return an IEnumerator, so you can add Coroutines for this event. It is valid to return null if it is not a coroutine.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.ItemInfo.GetDefaultAttackType(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the default attack routine for the given ItemInfo, assuming that it is has a vanilla ID. It is recommended to set OnAttack to this if you are overriding a vanilla weapon. This is only valid to use without specifying the ID parameter after registering the item.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.ItemInfo.SwingSword(PlayerScript)
member.summary: Attack routine for swinging a sword. Register this to OnAttack to make your weapon behave this way. Preserves the ID-specific behavior of the base game, so if the ItemInfo's ID matches the ID of a vanilla item, it will behave in the exact same way that the vanilla item of the same ID would.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.ItemInfo.SwingGiantSword(PlayerScript)
member.summary: Attack routine for swinging a giant sword, which is 50% larger than a regular sword. Giant swords in the base game are the Colossus, Heaven's Cloud, Caius' Demonblade, Zweihander, Claymore, and Azazel's Blade. Register this to OnAttack to make your weapon behave this way. Preserves the ID-specific behavior of the base game, so if the ItemInfo's ID matches the ID of a vanilla item, it will behave in the exact same way that the vanilla item of the same ID would.

member.name: T:GadgetCore.API.ItemType
member.summary: Specifies what type of item this is. These represent a set of flags, so they can be combined and masked using the | and & operators respectively. I.E: 'ItemType.LOOT | ItemType.TIER1 | ItemType.ROCK'. Please note that EQUIPABLE is incompatible with LOOT, EMBLEM, USABLE, and CONSUMABLE, and attempts to combine them will result in unexpected results. Also note that the top 16 bits are flags for general use, and will be ignored by Gadget Core. They can be set using FLAG1-FLAG16

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.GENERIC
member.summary: There is absolutely nothing special about this item. It can't be used or equipped, and it isn't any sort of loot or other tiered item.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.LOOT
member.summary: This item is loot, as is used in the emblem forge and the alchemy table. Note that a tier and loot type should also be set. Incompatible with EQUIPABLE.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.EMBLEM
member.summary: This item is an emblem, as is used in the gear forge and creation machine. Note that a tier and loot type should also be set. Incompatible with EQUIPABLE.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.USABLE
member.summary: This item can be used from the hotbar, and doing so will invoke OnUse. Incompatible with EQUIPABLE.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.CONSUMABLE
member.summary: When this item is used, one of it should be consumed. Implies USABLE.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.EQUIPABLE
member.summary: This item can be equipped. Note that this alone does not actually make it equipable, since no equip slot will take it. Incompatible with LOOT, EMBLEM, USABLE, and CONSUMABLE.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.WEAPON
member.summary: This item is a weapon, and can as such can be equipped to the weapon slot. Implies EQUIPABLE, NONSTACKING, LEVELING, and MODABLE. Use BASIC_MASK to strip all but the EQUIPABLE implication.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.OFFHAND
member.summary: This item is an offhand, and can as such can be equipped to the offhand slot. Implies EQUIPABLE, NONSTACKING, LEVELING, and MODABLE. Use BASIC_MASK to strip all but the EQUIPABLE implication.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.HELMET
member.summary: This item is a helmet, and can as such can be equipped to the helmet slot. Implies EQUIPABLE, NONSTACKING, LEVELING, and MODABLE. Use BASIC_MASK to strip all but the EQUIPABLE implication.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.ARMOR
member.summary: This item is an armor, and can as such can be equipped to the armor slot. Implies EQUIPABLE, NONSTACKING, LEVELING, and MODABLE. Use BASIC_MASK to strip all but the EQUIPABLE implication.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.RING
member.summary: This item is a ring, and can as such can be equipped to a ring slot. Implies EQUIPABLE, NONSTACKING, LEVELING, and MODABLE. Use BASIC_MASK to strip all but the EQUIPABLE implication.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.DROID
member.summary: This item is a droid, and can as such can be equipped to a droid slot. Implies EQUIPABLE, NONSTACKING, and LEVELING. Use BASIC_MASK to strip all but the EQUIPABLE implication.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.MOD
member.summary: This item is a gear mod, and as such can be installed into weapons, offhands, helmets, armors, and rings. Note that this is non-functional in this version of Gadget Core.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.STACKING
member.summary: This item can stack. Note that this flag is meaningless to set, and is only intended to be used for querying as such: ({Item Type} & ItemType.NONSTACKING) == ItemType.STACKING

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.NONSTACKING
member.summary: This item cannot stack. If an equipable item does not have this flag set, unexpected behavior may occur.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.LEVELING
member.summary: This item is able to level up. Also causes the item to show the background that displays the item's rarity tier. If a leveling item is able to stack, unexpected behavior may occur.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.MODABLE
member.summary: This item is able to have mods installed into it. If a modable item is able to stack, unexpected behavoir may occur. Note that this is non-functional in this version of Gadget Core.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.TIER1
member.summary: This item is tier 1. This is meaningless if the item is not either a LOOT or an EMBLEM.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.TIER2
member.summary: This item is tier 2. This is meaningless if the item is not either a LOOT or an EMBLEM.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.ROCK
member.summary: This item is a rock material. This is meaningless if the item is not either a LOOT or an EMBLEM.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.PLANT
member.summary: This item is a plant material. This is meaningless if the item is not either a LOOT or an EMBLEM. Implies ORGANIC.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.MONSTER
member.summary: This item is a monster material. This is meaningless if the item is not either a LOOT or an EMBLEM. Implies ORGANIC.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.BUG
member.summary: This item is a bug material. This is meaningless if the item is not either a LOOT or an EMBLEM. Implies ORGANIC.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.OTHER
member.summary: This item is some other form of material besides the standard four. This is meaningless if the item is not either a LOOT or an EMBLEM.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.ItemType.ORGANIC
member.summary: This item is considered to be an organic material, and as such can be placed into the alchemy station if it is also a LOOT.

member.name: T:GadgetCore.API.LootTables
member.summary: Used for management of loot tables.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.LootTables.DropLoot(System.String,UnityEngine.Vector3,System.Single)
member.summary: Call to cause a loot table's contents to drop at the given location. dropFrequency specifies how much to delay between each dropped item.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.LootTables.AddToLootTable(GadgetCore.API.ItemInfo,System.String,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Func{UnityEngine.Vector3,System.Boolean},System.Func{Item,UnityEngine.Vector3,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Adds the item to a drop table. Note that maxDropQuantity is optional, and if left unspecified minDropQuantity will always be dropped. Also returns the ItemInfo this was called on, for convenience in chaining calls.
member.param: The item to add to the drop table. Note that the quantity specified is entirely ignored. This may be null, if you wish to entirely rely upon CustomDropBehavior
The loot table to add this item to.
The chance for this item to drop from 0.0 to 1.0. If dropChance is higher than 1.0, then it will still just always drop. Similarly, if it is less than 0.0, then it will simply never drop.
The minimum quantity to be dropped. If maxDropQuantity is not specified, then this will always be the quantity that is dropped.
The maximum quantity to be dropped. If this is set, then a random quantity from minDropQuantity to maxDropQuantity will be dropped.

Use to add custom behavior to check whether to drop an item in a given circumstance. This is always called when the loot table is dropped, even if the drop chance fails. Receives the position to be dropped at as a parameter.

Use to add custom behavior for how to drop the item(s). This is only called after it has been confirmed that an item will drop based on the drop chance and CheckValidToDrop. This will be called once for each item dropped in the case of non-stackable items. Receives the position to be dropped at, as well as the Item with the quantity set, as parameters.

member.name: T:GadgetCore.API.MathUtils
member.summary: Provides a few simple convenience methods related to math.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.MathUtils.IsPerfectSquare(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns true if value is a perfect square. Otherwise returns false.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.MathUtils.NextPerfectSquare(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the next perfect square after value. Value does not have to be a perfect square itself.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.MathUtils.SmallestPerfectSquare(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the smallest perfect square that is at least value. If value is already a perfect square, returns value.

member.name: T:GadgetCore.API.PlayerGearModsTracker
member.summary: Tracks what gear mods each player has, since for some reason the base game does not do this.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.PlayerGearModsTracker.GetGearMods(PlayerScript)
member.summary: In theory, returns the gear mods that the given player has, in the same format as GameScript.MODS. In practice, it currently just returns GameScript.MODS. This exists so that Gadget Core can later add this functionality without it being a breaking change. As such, whenever you need to query what gear mods the player has, you should use this.

member.name: T:GadgetCore.API.StatModifierType
member.summary: Indicates the type of stat modifier the modifier being applied is. Note that they are applied in the order Flat -> AddMult -> ExpMult. Also note that the 'AddMult' types are additive multipliers, meaning that, for example, returning EquipStats.ONE will double the base stats.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.StatModifierType.BaseFlat
member.summary: Adds a flat modifier to the item's true base stats.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.StatModifierType.BaseAddMult
member.summary: Adds a multiplicative modifier based off of the item's true base stats to the item's modified base stats.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.StatModifierType.BaseExpMult
member.summary: Applies a multiplicative modifier based off of the item's modified base stats.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.StatModifierType.LevelFlat
member.summary: Adds an otherwise flat modifier that scales with the item's level.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.StatModifierType.LevelAddMult
member.summary: Adds a multiplicative modifier based off of the item's base stats that scales with each level.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.StatModifierType.LevelExpMult
member.summary: Applies a multiplicative modifier based off the item's modified stats that scales with each level. WARNING: Think about what you are doing before using this one. Thanks to the level scaling, things can get out of hand very quickly.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.StatModifierType.Flat
member.summary: Adds a simple flat modifier to the item's stats. Behaves the same way as the bonuses from item quality, or stat-boosting gear mods do.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.StatModifierType.AddMult
member.summary: Adds a simple multiplicative modifier based of the item's base stats.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.StatModifierType.ExpMult
member.summary: Applies a simple multiplicative modifier based of the item's modified stats.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.StatModifierType.FinalFlat
member.summary: Adds a flat modifier that is applied after all non-Final modifiers have been applied.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.StatModifierType.FinalAddMult
member.summary: Adds a multiplicative modifier based off of the item's final stats pre-modification that is applied after all non-Final modifiers have been applied.

member.name: F:GadgetCore.API.StatModifierType.FinalExpMult
member.summary: Applies a multiplicative modifier based off of the item's final modified stats that is applied after all other modifiers have been applied.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the WeakReference class, referencing the specified object and using the specified resurrection tracking.
member.param: An object to track.
Indicates when to stop tracking the object. If true, the object is tracked after finalization; if false, the object is only tracked until finalization.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.API.WeakReference`1.GetTarget
member.summary: Gets the object (the target) referenced by the current WeakReference object.
member.returns: null if the object referenced by the current System.WeakReference object has been garbage collected; otherwise, a reference to the object referenced by the current System.WeakReference object.
member.exception: The reference to the target object is invalid. This exception can be thrown while setting this property if the value is a null reference.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.Loader.GadgetLoader.UnloadMod(GadgetCore.Loader.GadgetMod)
member.summary: Unloads the given GadgetMod. Cannot fully release the mod's RAM usage, as the old instance of the mod assembly that is stored in RAM cannot be fully removed. WARNING: Will trigger an immediate garbage collection, causing a short freeze!

member.name: M:GadgetCore.Loader.GadgetLoader.RefreshMod(GadgetCore.Loader.GadgetMod@)
member.summary: Soft-reloads the given GadgetMod. (Does not load it freshly from the disk). Also refreshes all mods that are dependent on this mod. Be warned that this only reloads the mod's instances, so some mods may not function as expected after a refresh.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.Loader.GadgetLoader.RefreshMod(GadgetCore.Loader.GadgetMod)
member.summary: Soft-reloads the given GadgetMod. (Does not load it freshly from the disk). Also refreshes all Gadgets that are dependent on these Gadgets. Be warned that this only reloads the mod's instances, so some mods may not function as expected after a refresh.

member.name: M:GadgetCore.Loader.GadgetLoader.ReloadMod(GadgetCore.Loader.GadgetMod@)
member.summary: Hard-reloads the given GadgetMod. (Loads it freshly from the disk). Also reloads all mods that are dependent on this mod. Causes a permanent increase in the game's RAM usage, as the old instance of the mod assembly that is stored in RAM cannot be fully removed. WARNING: Will trigger an immediate GC collection, causing a short freeze!

member.name: M:GadgetCore.Loader.GadgetLoader.ReloadMod(GadgetCore.Loader.GadgetMod)
member.summary: Hard-reloads the given GadgetMod. (Loads it freshly from the disk). Also reloads all mods that are dependent on this mod.
